subject: Standard Operating Procedure for processing of proposals for consideration of LA Committee.
text: HRry <74fly TTHN gfaqrrvt 44 / Phone : 91-11-25074100/25074200 (Hed rdev &1 TTHNf #la4) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) &a 6, 7427-10, E1raT, 7 fvait 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Land Acquisition /2021 Policy Guidelines No. 7.1.69 /2021 Dated 013 February, 2021 (Decision taken on e-file Comp. No. 61024) Sub: Standard Operating Procedure for processing of proposals for consideration of LA Committee_ Refer  Policy  Circular No 7.1.61/2019 dated 23.10.2019 regarding Optimization of Planning and Execution of NH Projects vide Which guidelines were issued for two stage approval of the Project by the Land Acquisition Committee (LAC)  During the recent meetings of LAC,it was observed that the presentations made by the Technical Divisions do not contain specific information /maps which can facilitate easy decision making: 2. Accordingly, it has been decided that the standard presentation before LAC shall include the following minimum' details in that order: Name of the Project in brief. State with proposed corridor /alignment marked. (iii) Project with proposed corridor marked with clear marking of existing roads from which traffic is likely to come on the proposed corridor/ project and status of development of proposed corridor (projects completed/ in progress/ balance for award). Alignment Options of the project with different colours/length. (iv) In case of Road / Bypass, distance from habitat area on the City Master Plan. 3 In next slides, the following details should be given: Name of Scheme under which included [e.g. Bharatmala /NHDP/NH(O) etc:] Corridor Type (e:g. Economic Corridor, Expressway etc:) (iii) Alignment Type (Greenfield/ Brownfield): If Brownfield, whether Greenfield option explored? Details thereof . (iv) Existing ROW Proposed ROW LA Requirement (Ha) (vii) Existing Traffic(PCU) (viii) Expected Traffic(PCU) (ix) Estimated Civil Construction Cost (x) Estimated LA Cost & Cost / Ha (xi) Estimated Capital Cost (xii) IRR (xiii) In case of Road/ Bypasses, the share cf concerned State Govt. in LA Cost, if any. (xiv) Whether land monetisation options/ integration with Logistic Park etc. explored to improve IRR? If yes, details thereof. Note: The above presentation would be in addition to the datal details presently uploaded on LAC portal. I9 Contd. P/2 '#T 7 & 9 NHAL 5-5 Map Map along Ring Ring being
